author: atrauzzi
body:
# Summary of the new feature/enhancement

When I'm using bash, if I type something like `make <tab>`, I get a full list of the available tasks.  This spans across the ecosystem where many applications can surface items for auto-completion outside of simply resolving files from `pwd`.

# Proposed technical implementation details (optional)

Really, just do what bash does when I press tab for applications that surface this extra information. 🙂
title: Parity with bash tab completion for applications
